fields.description:
Currently the problem URL link for JIRA issue is incorrect in *Code Changes tab*. When user click on the link it will be directed to the following error:
!exception.png|tumbnail!

+Step to replicate+
# Configure [Bamboo integrate with JIRA|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO034/Integrating+Bamboo+with+JIRA]
# Link an issue to a build 
# Commit a changes with a massage with jira issue key(eg: BAMBOTEST-1) to the repository and run the build
# You will probably able to see the Code changes as shown in the following:
!Code_changes_problem.png|tumbnail!
# Click on the jira issue link and the URL provided is base on Bamboo base URL

This does not happen in builds Summary page:
!summary_page.png!

Current, workaround please click the link in the Summary tab
fields.summary: JIRA issue URL link is incorrect in build Code Changes Tab

fields.description:
The puppet output, for instance, includes ascii color escape codes which cause the usual Linux terminal to color the output.
e.g.
{noformat}
^[[0;32minfo: Loading facts in basebuildsystemfacts^[[0m
{noformat}
Will cause the text "info: Loading facts in basebuildsystemfacts" to be displayed in green.

My suggestion is to identify such sequences in the log output and if they make sense (e.g. every color start tag (e.g. "^[[0;32m" above) is matched by a "close tag" ("^[[0m") then start paying attention to them and convert to HTML <div style="color:green"...> tags.
Add a UI option to turn this on and off.
The idea of disabling it and making sure that tags make sense is that if the log really contains some binary junk which happens to look like color codes then it'll be possible to see it as it is.

I haven't found Java implementation for this but here are a couple of links to code which does this in other languages:
# Stackoverflow discussion: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/245121/a-library-to-convert-ansi-escapes-terminal-formatting-color-codes-to-html
# C program (page in German, but links to C source code): http://ziz.delphigl.com/tool_aha.php
# Perl module: http://search.cpan.org/~nuffin/HTML-FromANSI/lib/HTML/FromANSI.pm
fields.summary: Convert ANSI color codes to HTML when displaying logs

We ask customers to explicitly set bamboo.jms.broker.uri in bamboo-init.properties file:

I think this isn't required & the format is incorrect.
fields.summary: Don't need to set bamboo.jms.broker.uri in bamboo-init.properties

fields.description:
Currently we have two methods: one that returns configuration specific to a plan and one that always returns configuration for master.
What we need is one method that returns merged configuration - patched master's configuration for branch and plain master's configuration for master.
At the same time, we want to be able to edit the branch specific configuration and save it without accidentally snapshotting master's configuration.

This is needed for BranchIntegration configuration - it resides in Branch-specific configuration and is not available in the build context.

fields.description: All icons generated by {{[@ui.macro }} will use BaseURL to generate the {{}} attribute. In case of accessing Bamboo using different URL or in case of Bamboo move to another server and not updated BaseURL all those icons might disappear thus making some Bamboo features unusable (ie Scheduled Backups cron expression editor https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-6402?focusedCommentId=2366316&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2366316)

Deleting a plan deletes it's branches. Immediately. 

The existing warning notice should be extra loud about this - as of 4.0-SNAPSHOT build 2904 it's silent.
fields.summary: The plan deletion warning should shout out that all plan branches will also be deleted

fields.description:
Bitbucket: http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/hgNODQ
Github: http://help.github.com/post-receive-hooks/

Bamboo should have a single URL where the webhooks post their data "http://tardigrade.sydney.atlassian.com:8085/bamboo/rest/latest/changes" (or similar).

# User registers the hook on Bitbucket or Github
# User commits and pushes to repository
# Github/Bitbucket POSTs the change information as JSON to the Bamboo URL
# For Plans where the repository URL matches the repository URL in the JSON data
** Detect branches for Plan if the JSON data contains a reference to a branch Bamboo is not aware about
** Detect changes for Plan if the Plan is using a Remote build strategy.
fields.summary: Use webhooks for branch and change detection

fields.description:
When integrated with Crowd, Bamboo doesn't respect the Active/Inactive status of the user when sending notifications.

Real life example of why this is a problem:
1. Bamboo administrator has auto-favorites turned on and most build plans include notifications for watchers.
2. Over time, users leave the company and their account is marked inactive in crowd.
3. Bamboo continues to send an ever-increasing number of emails to users who are no longer active.
4. Email admins come after bamboo admin with pitchforks and torches for sending so much undeliverable mail.

Unfortunately, there's no way for the administrator to manage watchers on a build plan so there's currently no way for the administrator to prevent the emails from being sent without discontinuing notifications to all watchers.
fields.summary: Emails are sent to inactive users

fields.description: This happened recently on BEAC. The email (image attached) was incorrect & inconsistent in describing who had committed changes: it said "Code has been updated by Anatoli Kazatchkov" (who, as far as I can tell, has never committed anything in this project) when the commit was actually made by Cheryl Jerozal (who is correctly identified in the "Code Changes" section in the same email). This error was only in the email; the build summary screen online showed Cheryl's name correctly in both places.
fields.summary: In build result email, "Code has been updated by" sometimes shows the wrong user

fields.summary: Exception on MyBamboo->Responsibilities

fields.description:
It seems that the AgentContext (responsible for creation of HttpClient) created via reflection during bootstrap process does not inject the Host parameter correctly. Fingerprints/main classpath is loaded OK, but the bundled plugins aren't.
This is a regression introduced when we added Agent v2 support.
Workarounds:
- route all calls with Host header set to 127.0.0.1 directly to Bamboo's virtual host. The workaround cannot be used if the HTTP server fronts more than one Bamboo server.
- Set the BaseURL directly to non-fronted address. This does not mean that the non-fronted address has to be used for WWW access or exposed to Internet. I haven't tested this, but it will probably work.
fields.summary: EC2 Agents do not support virtual hosts after downloading classpath zip

fields.description:
It would be great if we could provide information about inefficiency of large Bamboo instance to use the schedule backup tool  which is bundle in Bamboo for example:
{quote}
We strongly recommend users not to use [Exporting Data for Backup|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO033/Exporting+Data+for+Backup] strategy as it is pron to be not efficient when the instance is large. We would suggest you to try the following documentation to do a backup on this matter:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO033/Backing+up+Bamboo+instances+over+4GB
{quote}

In the following documentation:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO033/Exporting+Data+for+Backup
fields.summary: Update Bamboo documentation related to schedule backup

fields.description:
This exploit can be seen from the My Bamboo Dashboard where the user's avatar is displayed.

h5. QA Notes
Verify correct encoding of alternate text of user's avatar is encoded correctly on other places e.g. When a user submits code changes

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user and set full name to be
{noformat}<script>alert(666)</script>{noformat}
# Login as user and navigate to My Bamboo dashboard - the script will execute
fields.summary: User avatar can serve as an XSS vector

fields.description:
This is something I use heavily when determining why builds failed.
The result navigator used to be for the job so this was possible.

That said the plan status widget was always plan only, so not sure what the solution is, but I need one.
fields.summary: Can not longer navigate between different results of the same job

fields.description: Branches will trigger off dependencies of the child plan, iff the child plan has a branch name that exactly matches the branch. Configuration for this will be enabled in the Plan level's Branch configuration
fields.summary: Dependencies for Plan Branches
Show important branches on Dashboard, Wallboard and Project views

fields.description: For https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/STRM-2037 we need the ExtendedAuthorManager available to do proper filtering of Bamboo tasks.
fields.summary: Make ExtendedAuthorManager available to plugins

fields.description:
e.g. branch selector.  

The config left nav is already sorted.
fields.summary: Sorting of branch lists

fields.description:
If the JIRA Server is down, The JiraIssueManager blows up badly, causing all sorts of horrible things to happen.  Like not reporting that issues even exist, Stacktraces on the UI etc, saying issues exist then showing a blank screen.

It should not propogate the error to the user, the user should still see the issue keys and a "could not fetch details" message.

This was also plaguing when writing a plugin that used the issue manager.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue pages should fail nicely if connection broken

fields.description:
Artifacts are not exported when "Export Artifacts" is checked while doing Export or running Scheduled Backups.

Also, build logs are not exported during the scheduled backup; however, build logs exist in the zip file while doing Export.
fields.summary: Artifacts are not exported when "Export Artifacts" is checked while doing Eport or running Scheduled Backups
Add support for compressed instance metadata

fields.description: As Brydie suggested in https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-BAM-3798#c71295
fields.summary: Make ImmutablePlanCacheService return ImmutablePlans as well

fields.description:
We are in a process of exploring Bamboo in the existing environment of our organization.
We would like have a plugin that enables Powerbroker authentication & autherization.
fields.summary: Powerbroker user management plugin
JIRA logo on job Issues tab should be updated

fields.description: Other text on that tab refers to 'requirements'.
fields.summary: Job Requirements tab should have 'Requirement' as column header, not 'Capability'

fields.description:
From customer;
bq. I would like to be able to determine whether or not a task failed by looking in the log file for specific error messages (reqular expression search). If the string is found I want the task to be failed. Is there a direct way to do this within Bamboo or do I need to go and add a final task everywhere that searches for the expression to all jobs? Curious since this is an out of the box feature of luntbuild and I was wondering if bamboo has anything similar.
fields.summary: Ability to define criteria for build outcome

fields.description:
The Screenshot on the doc page is incorrect:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Using+Bamboo+with+Clover

In addition to this, Clover integration is moved to the Miscellaneous tab
fields.summary: Update Clover integration docs
Implement Soy templating

fields.description: The ant execute type does not follow symbolic links .. and so it ends up trying to add "/bin/ant" on os x when given /usr/bin/ant (which is a symbolic link).
fields.summary: The ant task does not follow symbolic links

fields.description:
Under Branch Detection:

Branch Detection

Enable Branch Detection to *automaticly* create a...
fields.summary: Typo in Branches Config screen: 'automaticly' should be 'automatically'
contents of external_entity and external_member not exported

fields.description:
CBAC (3.4-rc2).

After installing a new version of a plugin (plugins 2 plugin) containing a set of tasks, the remote agents don't seem to pick up the new version. They do instead keep using the old version. This is usually rectified by restarting Bamboo.
fields.summary: Build agents don't pick up changes to tasks after updating the plugin in Bamboo

fields.description:
I have a quite fragile build that I would know would fail by just looking at the first couple hundreds of lines in the jira.log - there is no way to read them before the whole build finishes (which is much later)

I would love to have ability to see my target/jira.log online in the same way I see the mvn log.

Such log file might be defined as a special case of artifact that would be streamed on Plan/build log page in addition to the maven log

fields.description:
I have a build that is supposed to be run with specified Working Sub Directory
I have selected that the plan will produce test results.

I understand that "standard test results directory" is relative to the WorkingSub Directory, but it is not written anywhere.

Could the option just print what it considers "standard" so there are no doubts or surprises later on?

fields.description:
1) (MAJOR) The old/new values in the audit log are truncated. Where the change happened later in the string (as per the screen shot), it is IMPOSSIBLE to tell what changed.

Desired: always display all the text, perhaps with inner scrollbars.

2) The CSS styles for the old/new value are different. The Old wraps, the New truncates, and you have to scroll all the way to the bottom of the page to use the horizontal scrollbar for that DIV.

3) (Stretch) steal the diff code that JIRA uses in it's emails to highlight the differences between the Old and New values.
fields.summary: "Old Value" and "New Value" are truncated in the Plan Audit Log
Bamboo does not respect the quotes (") in the command line arguments on windows ( at least for the ANT task)
Implement getLastCommitDate in GitRepository

fields.description:
I had an installed Bamboo instance from when I completed Dragon Slaying about 6 months ago. I had forgotten about it.

I attempted to install Bamboo again using the atlassian-bamboo-4.0-m2-standalone-windows-x32.exe

The installer said nothing about the detection of an existing instance and continued installing. I was under the impression I was getting a brand new instance.

However, when I attempted to login using admin/admin I could not. Since I had anonymous access enabled from my dragon slaying, I could see that the data was left over from my dragon slaying.

I blew away the old home directory and the old app directory as well as the new home directory and the new app directory.

I ran the installer again and it completed. However, I had to click "InstallAsAService" and manually start the Bamboo service before I could even access the true installation / setup screens.

It would be a lot smoother if the installation had more sensitive detection for existing installations as well as automation of the InstallAsAService and starting of the Bamboo Service.
fields.summary: Installing a second bamboo instance on the same box is difficult
Create documentation on how to configure NUnit Runner task

fields.description: Would be interesting to see build plans with the option to automatically remove older results. In the plan options you could enable a result cleanup and only have it keep the last X number of results. Results that were past the X number would be automatically removed, saving space on the Bamboo server. Ideally this would be purely optional
fields.summary: Only keep X number of build results per plan option

fields.description:
Steps to the problem:
>I added a remote agent, it installs and runs perfect.
>Added a capability under Executables - C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe  (to run batch scripts or executables)


>When I create a plan, I add a task under a Job, using CMD as the executable.
>I pass in the arguments as [ /c "C:\Windows\System32\notepad.exe" ]

Now when I run the plan, it launches the notepad, but it launches it minimized. I want to run some Sikuli Tests eventually, but it will be a major problem if the applications launch minimized.

fields.description:
Example 
Crucible Project Key: PROJ-123

The log messages in Bamboo will show the App calling JIRA for the crucible project Key. JIRA will try to search in its own projects. It won't find it. However Bamboo will still create a link to the Fisheye/Crucible App (if there is a link between Bamboo and Fisheye) using the Base URL, not the link to the Crucible project.
fields.summary: Bamboo-Fisheye Plugin tries to link to Crucible Projects

fields.description:
I have a number of builds that are nearly identical except that they use global variables for a version number, so that teams can change the version for a range of tests at once.

Currently, the only way to see the value of the variable is to either look at the build logs or the global variables screen.

It would be useful to be able to reference a variable in a build or stage description.  With that, you could have the description say something like:

# "This build tests my plugin trunk against the oldest compatible version of JIRA (4.3.2)"
# "This build tests the latest stable version of the plugin (2.10) against the upcoming maintenance branch of Confluence (4.0-SNAPSHOT)"
fields.summary: Use global variables in a plan name or description....
'buildKey' db field in 'build' table is superflous

fields.summary: Tardigrade throwing UnsupportedOperationExceptions
No email notification is being sent to commiters when a plan fails

fields.description:
Dependent builds have the ability to build just their parent build's revision.

However when detecting changes to be included in the dependent build, It will still obey the quiet period rules, even though they are redundant as the top revision is mandated.

It can actually wait twice. As we do two change detections and then subtract.
fields.summary: Potential unecessary sleeping when dependent build has a quiet period enabled

fields.description:
If on the second retry, a file is committed that the user doesn't care about, it is still counted as a commit, and Bamboo will wait the quite period again. This could cause unecessary waiting.

It feel like if the only files detected after the quiet period are excluded files, we should go ahead and build anywayy.
fields.summary: QuietPeriod retries dont filter excluded changes

fields.description:
- set up a plan with at least one manual stage
- configure an "all builds completed" IM notification for it
- run the plan
- notice an IM pop up as soon as it pauses on the manual stage...
"Cache > Project Deploy Pipeline phase 2 > #3 was SUCCESSFUL. 
All 8 jobs passed with 13 tests in total.
http://172.28.15.92:8085/browse/CACHE-DEPL2-3/"

In this case, only 2 of my 8 jobs had been executed.  If I hit the continue button, the notification will get sent again when the plan pauses on another manual stage and/or the plan completes for real. 

Could we update the message to say something like "2 of 8 jobs have executed with 13 tests in total"?
fields.summary: "All Builds Completed" notification message reports on un-executed jobs in plans that have a manual stage

fields.description: We need better documentation for auto agent upgrade... it would be good to give customers more insight into how the upgrade works.

fields.description:

The first four links all link to JST-JST instead of BON-BON. This is really strange.
fields.summary: Incorrect links on plan summary page

fields.description:
In any circumstance where gmail actually rewrites the email content e.g. to distribute to group members.  It will rewrite the mulipart parts in an incorrect order, resulting in the html part being first instead of last. 

We have tracked this down to a superfluous part which atlassian-mail adds to the top of the emails.  When removed the emails get rewriten correctly.
fields.summary: Html email show as text after gmail rewrites email
